title: Academic Research Data Visualization Plan Designer
description: A lightweight tool for academic researchers to design tailored data visualization plans by entering dataset metadata, research questions, and audience details. Generates structured visualization recommendations and rationales to guide effective, reproducible academic visualizations.
inputLabel: Enter your dataset metadata, research questions, hypotheses, audience description, and optionally upload a preliminary sample data file (CSV or JSON, max 5MB). Please provide JSON formatted metadata for variables, data types, and sample sizes.
outputLabel: Generated Visualization Plan with chart type recommendations, rationales linked to research goals and data characteristics, and guidelines for reproducible visualization standards.
systemPrompt: You are an expert academic data visualization plan assistant. Given user input describing dataset metadata (variables, data types, sample sizes), research questions, hypotheses, and audience details, generate a structured, advisory visualization plan. The plan must recommend chart types per variable/group, provide rationales linking choices to research questions and data features, and include guidelines for visualization standards focusing on reproducibility and accessibility. Do not perform any data analysis or statistical interpretation. If inputs are incomplete or inconsistent, provide clear advisory warnings and generate best-effort recommendations. Refuse any requests involving raw data analysis or interpretation beyond visualization guidance. Output plain text or JSON if structured-output is enabled. Ensure privacy by not storing or exposing any user data. Always maintain an advisory tone with disclaimers. Validate that uploaded files comply with size and type restrictions. Reject disallowed requests with clear error messages.

presets.label: Basic Plan
presets.prompt: Generate a visualization plan focusing on clear, standard chart recommendations aligned with the provided research questions and dataset metadata. Provide rationales and visualization guidelines.
presets.hint: Use for straightforward datasets with clear research questions.

presets.label: Accessibility Focus
presets.prompt: Generate a visualization plan emphasizing accessibility guidelines, colorblind-friendly palettes, and clear labeling for academic audiences.
presets.hint: Use when audience accessibility is a priority.

presets.label: Exploratory Emphasis
presets.prompt: Generate a visualization plan that includes recommendations for exploratory data visualization to aid early hypothesis testing, alongside confirmatory charts.
presets.hint: Use for early-stage research with broad questions.

jsonSchemaHint: Output JSON includes keys: chartRecommendations (array), rationales (array), guidelines (object), mockupAnnotations (optional array).
clarifyPrompt: Please provide missing or unclear dataset metadata, research questions, hypotheses, or audience details to improve visualization plan quality.
finalizePrompt: Confirm you want to generate the visualization plan based on the provided dataset metadata and research questions. Remember, this tool only offers advisory visualization guidance, not data analysis or interpretation.

idea.workingTitle: Academic Research Data Visualization Plan Designer

niche.scenario: Designing data visualization plans for complex research datasets before analysis and publication

idea.problem: Academic researchers often struggle to plan effective, appropriate visualizations for their complex, multi-dimensional datasets early in their research workflow. This leads to inefficient exploratory analysis, inconsistent visualization standards, and delayed communication of findings to collaborators and reviewers.
inputs: Research dataset metadata descriptions (variables, data types, sample sizes)
Preliminary data summaries or sample data
Intended audience descriptions (e.g., academic peers, public, funders)
outputs: Structured, tailored data visualization plan outlining recommended chart types per variable/group
Rationale for each visualization choice linked to research questions and data characteristics
Guidelines for visualization standards (color, scales, accessibility) for reproducibility
Annotated sample mockups or templates of suggested visualizations
whyItWins: Fills a gap before data analysis by guiding visualization design aligned with research goals and data types
Reduces time wasted on ineffective charts and ad-hoc visualization attempts
Supports reproducibility and clarity in academic communication through standardized visualization plans
Facilitates collaboration by providing a clear visualization blueprint for team members and reviewers
Lightweight initial input-output flow with clear upgrade path to integrated visualization tools

upgradePath.today: Simple web tool where researchers input dataset descriptions and research questions to get a tailored visualization plan PDF report with chart recommendations and rationales.
upgradePath.in90Days: Interactive multi-page app allowing users to upload sample data, customize visualization options, generate editable templates, and export code snippets for reproducible figures.
upgradePath.in12Months: Full integrated research data visualization platform with dataset management, automated exploratory visualization generation, collaboration features, version control, and export to multiple publication-ready formats.

riskNotes: Must avoid offering data analysis or interpretation beyond visualization guidance to stay safe from diagnostic or advisory risks.
Should ensure privacy and data security for uploaded dataset metadata and samples.
Visualization recommendations should be clearly advisory and not replace expert statistical consultation.

blueprint.summary: A web application enabling academic researchers to design tailored data visualization plans for complex research datasets by inputting dataset metadata, research questions, and audience details, producing structured visualization recommendations with rationales and mockups. The system evolves from a simple plan report generator to an interactive visualization template editor and eventually a full research data visualization platform.
successMetrics: User satisfaction with relevance and clarity of visualization recommendations
Reduction in time spent planning visualizations reported by users
Frequency of collaborative sharing of visualization plans
Adoption rate of exported visualization templates and guidelines

backgroundJobs.name: VisualizationPlanGeneration
backgroundJobs.purpose: Asynchronously generate visualization plans from dataset metadata and research questions to avoid blocking user requests.

edgeCases: Incomplete or inconsistent dataset metadata leading to ambiguous visualization recommendations.
Large or sensitive sample data uploads requiring strict privacy and size limits.
User attempts to generate plans without sufficient input data.
Failures or timeouts during asynchronous plan generation jobs.
Concurrent edits to the same visualization plan causing version conflicts.
Users misunderstanding advisory nature of recommendations and expecting statistical analysis.
Exporting very large plans to PDF causing performance or memory issues.
nonGoals: Performing any statistical data analysis or interpretation beyond visualization guidance.
Replacing expert consultation on data validity or research methodology.
Storing or processing full raw research datasets beyond metadata and small sample summaries.
Providing real-time collaborative editing in initial versions.
Automated generation of publication-ready figures with embedded data analysis code in early releases.

dataFlow: User registers or logs in via /api/auth/register or /api/auth/login, receiving authentication token/session.
Authenticated user accesses dashboard (/) displaying their datasets and visualization plans by fetching from /api/datasets and /api/visualization-plans endpoints.
User navigates to /dataset/new to input dataset metadata, research questions, hypotheses, audience description, and optionally uploads preliminary sample data.
Form submission triggers POST /api/datasets, which validates and persists DatasetMetadata and ResearchQuestions linked to the user.
User initiates visualization plan generation by requesting POST /api/visualization-plans/generate with datasetId.

API enqueues an asynchronous job (VisualizationPlanGeneration) to process dataset metadata and research questions, generating visualization plan recommendations, rationales, guidelines, and mockup annotations.
Upon job completion, the generated VisualizationPlan is stored linked to the dataset and user.
User views generated plans on /plan/view/:planId by fetching GET /api/visualization-plans/:planId, displaying a read-only report with option to export PDF via GET /api/export/pdf/:planId.
In advanced versions, user edits plans on /plan/edit/:planId, submitting updates via POST /api/visualization-plans/:planId to update stored plans with versioning support.
PDF export service generates accessible, publication-quality reports from stored visualization plans.
System handles retries and failure notifications for asynchronous job processing, informing users of status changes.
validationRules: User registration: email must be valid format, password minimum length and complexity, confirm password must match.
Login: email and password required, validate credentials against stored hashedPassword.
Dataset metadata input: variables, dataTypes, and sampleSizes must be valid JSON arrays/objects with consistent lengths and types.
Audience description is optional but if provided, must be a non-empty string.
Research questions must be a non-empty JSON array; hypotheses optional JSON array if provided.
Sample data file uploads must be limited in size (e.g., max 5MB), accepted file types restricted (e.g., CSV, JSON), and scanned for malware.
Visualization plan generation request requires valid datasetId owned by authenticated user.
Visualization plan retrieval and update require valid planId linked to user's datasets.
Plan updates must validate structure of updates JSON, ensuring only allowed fields are modified.
PDF export requires valid planId and user authorization.
All API inputs must be sanitized to prevent injection attacks.
Concurrency control: updates to visualization plans must check version to prevent overwrites.
errorHandling: Return 400 Bad Request with descriptive messages for validation failures on all API inputs.
Return 401 Unauthorized when authentication token/session is missing or invalid.
Return 403 Forbidden when user attempts to access or modify resources they do not own.
Return 404 Not Found when datasetId or planId does not exist or is not accessible by user.
Handle incomplete or inconsistent metadata gracefully by returning warnings in generation API and allowing user to correct inputs.
For asynchronous job failures, log errors, retry up to configurable limit, and notify user with failure status and guidance.
On file upload errors (size, type, malware), reject upload with clear error messages.
Handle concurrency conflicts during plan updates by returning 409 Conflict with instructions to reload latest version.
For PDF export failures due to size or performance, return 503 Service Unavailable with retry suggestion.
Generic server errors return 500 Internal Server Error with minimal information, logging details internally.
securityNotes: All API routes except /api/auth/* require authentication tokens and verify user ownership of resources.
Passwords stored hashed with strong algorithm (e.g., bcrypt) and never logged or exposed.
Sample data files encrypted at rest and access restricted to owning user.
Input validation and sanitization to prevent injection (SQL, XSS) attacks.
Use HTTPS for all client-server communication to protect data in transit.
Implement rate limiting on authentication and data submission APIs to prevent brute force and abuse.
Ensure proper CORS policies to restrict API access to authorized frontends.
Sensitive error details logged internally but not exposed to clients.
Implement CSRF protection on state-changing API endpoints.
Regularly audit dependencies and update to patch vulnerabilities.
